intro: Lytoneuron rosenstockii, commonly known as the Rosenstock's lytoneuron, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
